trans-unit.source: The member '{0}' with [DataMember] is not accessible to the serializer. Only public/internal/internal > protected visibility is supported, when the [DataMember] attribute is applied.
trans-unit.target: The member '{0}' with [DataMember] is not accessible to the serializer. Only public/internal/internal > protected visibility is supported, when the [DataMember] attribute is applied.

trans-unit.source: The serialization concept in Stride expects public/internal/internal protected visibility of properties. Other accessibility won't be considered for serialization. To count internal/internal protected as visible to the Editor the @Stride.Core.DataMemberAttribute has to be applied, else it's considered as not visible.
trans-unit.target: The serialization concept in Stride expects public/internal/internal protected visibility of properties. Other accessibility won't be considered for serialization. To count internal/internal protected as visible to the Editor the @Stride.Core.DataMemberAttribute has to be applied, else it's considered as not visible.

trans-unit.source: The following example generates STRDIAG003 on each property:
trans-unit.target: The following example generates STRDIAG003 on each property:

trans-unit.source: To resolve the warning, increase the Accessibility to public/internal/internal protected of the member or remove the @Stride.Core.DataMemberAttribute Attribute.
trans-unit.target: To resolve the warning, increase the Accessibility to public/internal/internal protected of the member or remove the @Stride.Core.DataMemberAttribute Attribute.
